b2s_clf.sampler package¶

Submodules¶

b2s_clf.sampler.sampler module¶

class b2s_clf.sampler.sampler_module.Sampler[source]¶

Bases: object

A class that samples and re-samples signal data with the option to read a subject data file to sample with respect to different strata.

combine_samplings(new_sampling)[source]¶

Adds the batches present in a second sampling to current sampling object. The second sampling must have been generated with the same input and output variables. Note that this will only check that the names match, the user will still have to make sure that the data is compatible or makes sense.

Parameters

new_sampling – Sampling object containing the batches to add.

extract_batch(index, y=False)[source]¶

Retrieve the numpy.ndarray stored in a particular batch.

Parameters

  • index – Index of the particular batch to extract.

  • y – If true, will retrieve the target vector.

Returns

The particular batch.

Return type

numpy.ndarray

generate_batches(df, n_batches, batch_len, target_variable, input_variables=None, balanced=True, resample=True, verbose=True)[source]¶

Generates batches from a pandas.DataFrame. Note that this will overwrite any existing batches.

Parameters

  • df – pandas.DataFrame from which to sample.

  • n_batches – Total number of batches to generate.

  • batch_len – Length of each batch.

  • target_variable – User-defined target variable.

  • input_variables – User-defined input variable list. If None, will simply take df column names.

  • balanced – Whether to balance the batches by target_variable.

  • resample – Whether to sample batches with replacement.

  • verbose – Whether to print progress on screen.

load_sampling(path, sampling_name)[source]¶

Will attempt to load an exsiting sampling from a local file.

Parameters

  • path – Path to file.

  • sampling_name – File name without extension.

save_sampling(path, sampling_name, mode='pickle')[source]¶

Will save a dictionary into a local path with generated batches

Parameters

  • path – Directory to store the output file.

  • sampling_name – Output file name.

  • mode – pickle or json
